channel.title: W3Schools Home Page

item.title: One of the world’s leading heart surgeons interviewed at the age of 87
item.description: Professor Sir Magdi Yacoub was one of the world’s leading heart surgeons.

item.title: Mother of 13-year old boy rammed of bike by police says she feels ‘betrayed’ by Met
item.description: The mother of a 13-year-old boy who was rammed off his bike by a police van and then surrounded by armed police after an officer mistook his toy water pistol for a real gun, says she feels ‘betrayed’ by the Metropolitan Police.

item.title: Storm Babet: Hundreds of homes told to evacuate in parts of Scotland
item.description: Hundreds of homes have been told to evacuate in parts of Scotland as Storm Babette heads their way – bringing record rain and winds gusting more than 77 miles an hour.

item.title: Bibby Stockholm: First group of asylum seekers brought back on board
item.description: The first group of asylum seekers has been brought back on board the Bibby Stockholm barge in Dorset, two months after the legionella bacteria was found in its water supply.

item.title: ‘The risk of Hezbollah getting directly involved is quite significant’, says former UK National Security Adviser
item.description: We spoke to Sir Mark Lyall Grant – a former senior British diplomat who was previously the United Kingdom’s National Security Adviser and Permanent Representative of the United Kingdom to the United Nations.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian supporters gather for vigil outside Downing Street
item.description: Rishi Sunak has called for a “calm and cool response” to the Gaza hospital blast – while intelligence services take time to establish the facts. Pro-Palestinian supporters have gathered outside Downing Street this evening at a vigil for victims.

item.title: Concern international tensions will push energy prices up
item.description: Rising petrol prices mean that inflation didn’t fall as expected last month. Instead, the annual rate of inflation remained stuck at 6.7%. There’s concern that growing international tensions will push up energy prices even more, meaning inflation here stays higher for longer.

item.title: ‘It would be hard for Iran and Hezbollah to stay out of Israel-Hamas war’ says former Israeli peace negotiator
item.description: Daniel Levy is President of the US/Middle East Project and a former peace negotiator who worked with previous Israeli prime ministers.

channel.item: SNP Conference: Council tax frozen in Scotland next year https://www.channel4.com/news/snp-conference-council-tax-frozen-in-scotland-next-year In his first conference speech as SNP leader, Humza Yousaf has called for an refugee programme for people fleeing violence in Gaza. 17 Oct 2023

item.title: Scottish National Party votes for independence push at next general election
item.description: The SNP will call for independence talks with the UK Government if it wins a majority of Scottish seats at the next general election.

item.title: Alice Litman Inquest: NHS delays contributed to trans woman taking her life
item.description: A coroner has concluded that NHS delays contributed to a decline in the mental health of Alice Litman – who took her own life last year after more than a thousand days waiting for gender-affirming healthcare. Her family says she’d been left to “languish”, and they will keep fighting for her and young trans people.…

item.title: Scotland’s First Minister feels ‘helpless’ watching his in-laws trapped in Gaza
item.description: Scotland’s First Minister Humza Yousaf sought to comfort the family of a Scot who died in the Hamas attacks – hugging the mother of Bernard Cowen at a service for him. His own family is caught up in the conflict – his wife’s parents trapped in Gaza after travelling there last week to visit a…

item.title: UK prisons in ‘terrible’ state, says former Chair of Criminal Bar Association
item.description: We spoke to Kirsty Brimelow KC, the former Chair of the Criminal Bar Association.

item.title: Judges in England and Wales told not to jail criminals as prisons are full
item.description: Judges have been told to delay the sentencing of criminals currently on bail because prisons are full, according to a report in today’s Times newspaper. This morning the Health Secretary Steve Barclay acknowledged that prisons “are under huge pressure”, adding that the Justice Secretary will make a statement to the commons on Monday. But he…
